title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-3.2 - General requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-3.2 - General requirements

State Regulations
(a) The requirements for the professional certificate shall be those in effect at
the time the initial certificate for the certificate title sought is issued, or
at the time the transitional certificate, as prescribed in section
80-3.5
(a) of this

Subpart, for the certificate title sought is issued. (b) The requirements set forth in Subpart
80-1 of this Part shall be applicable, unless the subject matter or terms of
such requirements prescribe otherwise. (c) The requirements for extensions or
annotations of certificates in the classroom teaching service set forth in

Subpart 80-4 of this Part shall be applicable. (d) Forms of certificates. (1)

Candidates for whom the requirements of
this Subpart are applicable, pursuant to the conditions prescribed in section
80-3.1
(a) of this

Subpart, shall be issued the following forms of certificates: initial
certificate, professional certificate, and transitional certificate. (2)

The certificate forms for pupil personnel
service shall be the forms prescribed in Subpart 80-2 of this Part. (3)

The certificate, license or credential
forms for supplemental school personnel, teaching in nonregistered evening
schools, and internship certificate shall be those prescribed in Subpart 80-5
of this Part. (e) Certificate titles. (1)

Certificate titles in the classroom teaching service. Candidates for whom the
requirements of this Subpart are applicable, pursuant to the conditions
prescribed in section
80-3.1
(a) of this

Subpart, shall be issued the following certificate titles in the classroom
teaching service: (i) Early Childhood

Education (birth-grade 2); (ii)

Childhood Education (grades 1-6); (iii)

Generalist in Middle Childhood

Education (grades 5-9); (iv)

English Language Arts (grades 5-9); (v) World language other than English
(specified) (grades 5-9); (vi)

Mathematics (grades 5-9); (vii)

Biology (grades 5-9); (viii)

Chemistry (grades 5-9); (ix)

Earth

Science (grades 5-9); (x) Physics
(grades 5-9); (xi)

Social Studies
(grades 5-9); (xii)

English

Language Arts (grades 7-12); (xiii)

World language other than English (specified) (grades 7-12); (xiv)

Mathematics (grades 7-12); (xv)

Biology (grades 7-12); (xvi)

Chemistry (grades 7-12); (xvii)

Earth Science (grades 7-12); (xviii)

Physics (grades 7-12); (xix)

Social Studies (grades 7-12); (xx)

Dance (all grades); (xxi)

Health Education (all
grades); (xxii)

Indigenous Culture
and Language Studies
(xxiii)

Music
(all grades); (xxiv)

Physical

Education (all grades); (xxv)

Theater (all grades); (xxvi)

Visual

Arts (all grades); (xxvii)

Computer

Science (all grades); (xxviii)

Students with Disabilities (birth-grade 2); (xxix)

Students with Disabilities (grades
1-6); (xxx)

Students with

Disabilities (grades 5-9); (xxxi)

Students with Disabilities (grades 7-12); (xxxii)

Students with Disabilities (all
grades)
(xxxiii)

Deaf and Hard of

Hearing (all grades); (xxxiv)

Blind
and Visually Impaired (all grades); (xxxv)

Speech and Language Disabilities (all
grades); (xxxvi)

English to

Speakers of other Languages (all grades); (xxxvii)

Literacy (birth-grade 6); (xxxviii)

Literacy (grades 5-12); (xxxix)

Library Media Specialist (all
grades); (xl)

Educational

Technology Specialist (all grades); (xli)

Agriculture (all grades); (xlii)

Business and Marketing (all
grades); (xliii)

Technology

Education (all grades); (xliv)

Specific agricultural subject titles (specified) (grades 7-12); (xlv)

Specific family and consumer science
titles (specified) (grades 7-12); (xlvi)

Specific technical subject titles
(specified) (grades 7-12); (xlvii)

Specific trade subject titles (specified) (grades 7-12); (2)

The certificate titles issued for pupil
personnel service shall be the titles prescribed in Subpart 80-2 of this

Part. (3)

The certificate, license
or credential titles for supplemental school personnel, teachers of adult, community and continuing education and internship certificate shall be those
prescribed in Subpart 80-5 of this Part. Notes

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
